Blackboard Redesign

How can students and teachers work more efficiently?

For a class, I worked with four other students, researching the workflow of college students via a contextual inquiry. I took this data forward into redesigning one of the most disliked pieces of software on the planet, Blackboard.

User Research

Our team found breakdowns in how students organized, completed, and submitted their work. We wanted to find out how these problems precludes learning, and how we could fix them.

We conducted contextual inquiries with 5 CMU students, and combined data from these interviews into cultural, sequence, and flow models. See contextual inquiry.

We created affinity diagrams, in which notes from interviews were organized into themes.

Ideation

After doing this user-needs research with the group for class, I decided to take this research a step forward and consider a blackboard redesign.

Some concept sketches from ideation.

Interactive UI Concept

When preparing for an assignment, students check emails, syllabi, schedules, slides, and various Blackboard sections to get the information they need. By centralizing and parsing this information, Blackboard could present everything in a much simpler, task list & calendar based format.

Wireframes of a new blackboard organization scheme.

To further test the interactivity of this concept, I developed an interactive HTML prototype. I used an organizational convention students were familiar with, akin to color-coded binder sections. Preliminary testing suggests this works well with students.

Screenshot of hi-fidelity HTML mockup

Yinzcam.com

Designing Yinzcam's online home.

I designed a website to show off yinzcam’s flagship product: fan apps for pro NFL, NHL and NBA teams. The sales copy is directed at sports fans, as well as prospective team front offices.

Venmo Homepage

Redesigning Venmo's homepage in accordance with its new app launches.

As an intern at Venmo, I redesigned the marketing pages of their website, including the landing page, product pages, and signup flows. After iterating on the design, I helped build the page alongside a full time Venmo employee.

Pittsburgh Tribune-Review

Designing a Mobile App for Pittsburgh 2nd Largest Newspaper

As an employee at Yinzcam, I acted as a design consultant for the Pittsburgh Tribune Review, which included the design of their mobile app.

Rock Your Jersey

How can we promote sports fan social media engagement?

At YinzCam, I was tasked with redesignin RockYourJersey, a webiste for sports events like the NFL PLayoffs, Super Bowl, NHL Winter Classic, and Penn State White & Blue game. The website was meant to generate buzz around the event, and create social media traction for event sponsors.

This was one of the my first experiences both designing and developing an application.

I created Illustrator scripts to generate vectors of 1000's of professional jerseys for RockYourJersey.

Giant Eagle

How can a tablet app help Giant Eagle employee training?

While at Yinzcam, I designed an iPad app to replace Giant Eagle’s thick employee training manual with a more quickly updatable solution.

The app operated in both landscape and portrait orientations.

Icons to visually depict store areas.

The project also involved the possibility of a web dashboard for creating and managing training modules. These wireframes explore that idea.

CMU CEE Department (Pittsburgh 2009 - Present)

Led a three person group working to visualize data from the Economic Input-Output Life Cycle Assessment, which asesses the environmental impact of economic activity between sectors.

Designed a tool for college decision-makers to visualize their sustainability peer-groups by comparing themselves to other schools on environmental metrics.
